·24· XI milia virgines 24 54
Endleuene þou&slong;end of virgines &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd imartrede were
Telle ichulle of heo&rrot;e marty&rrot;dom &punctelev; and ho heom þarto gan lere
A kyng þare wa&slong; in Brutayne &punctelev; sire Maur wa&slong; is name
Ane douȝter he hadde þat hiet Ourse &punctelev; þat wa&slong; of noble fame
Cri&slong;tine heo wa&slong; and al hire kun &punctelev; &slong;wiþe hende and quoynte
So fair womman Men men nu&slong;ten non &punctelev; no &slong;o guod in euerech pointe
¶Of hire fairhede and of hire guodne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; men tolden in eche &slong;ide
Þat þe wo&rrot;d cam into Enguelond &punctelev; and elle&slong;ȝwoder wel wide
A kyng þare wa&slong; þo in Enguelonde &punctelev; and Man man of gret poer
Gret nobleie he heo&rrot;de telle &punctelev; of þis maide feo&rrot; and ner
heis wille was gret þat is &slong;one &punctelev; þis Maide maide in &slong;pou&slong;hod hadde
Ake Men men þe ȝuyt in Enguelond &punctelev; cri&slong;tinedom Cri&slong;tinedom non nadden
¶Þe king of enguelond Enguelond þat wa&slong; þo &punctelev; to þe kyng of Brutayne gan &slong;iende
Fo&rrot; is douȝter to is &slong;one &punctelev; þat wa&slong; is heyr &slong;o hende
And &slong;eide ȝif þat he þare aȝen were &punctelev; þat þe dede nere ido
him and alle his he wolde de&slong;truyȝe &punctelev; and al his lond al&slong;o
Þo þis Me&slong;&slong;agers messagers comen to þis kyng &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e erinde hadden i&slong;eid
So&rrot;i and d&rrot;eo&rrot;i wa&slong; þis king &punctelev; he ne couþe þareof no red
Fo&rrot; þe king of Enguelond &punctelev; wa&slong; heþene and alle his
And fo&rrot; he wu&slong;te wel þat is douȝhter nolde &punctelev; iwedded beo iwis
And al&slong;o fo&rrot; þe kyng of Enguelond &punctelev; wa&slong; of so gret miȝhte
Þat he no &slong;trencþe ne miȝhte habbe &punctelev; aȝein him fo&rrot;to fiȝhte
And naþeles Triwe&slong; triwes of is an&slong;were &punctelev; aȝein þe me&slong;&slong;agers he nam
Deol and &slong;o&rrot; and luyte gladne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; in is heo&rrot;te þare cam
¶He ne tolde noþing is douȝter fo&rrot;e &punctelev; of þis reuful cas
Ȝeo&rrot;ne he bad god God niȝht and day &punctelev; fo&rrot; he redles was
And criede on him &slong;wiþe reufulliche &punctelev; þat he him &slong;cholde rede
A niȝht an Aungel aungel to is douȝter cam &punctelev; and þeos wo&rrot;de&slong; to hire &slong;ede
Ne beo þou nouȝht aȝein þis &slong;onde &punctelev; Ake ake þine fader fo&rrot;to paye
Graunte iwedded fo&rrot;to beo &punctelev; and bide þat he it delaiȝe
Ane þ&rrot;eo ȝer þat þou mouwe þe ȝwile &punctelev; þi Maidenhod maidenhod anoure
And þat huy þe purchace clene maidene&slong; &punctelev; with þe to habbe in þi boure
¶And þat þe king of Enguelonde and i&slong; &slong;one &punctelev; and þi fader beon alle at one rede
Þe fo&rrot;to cheo&slong;e ten clene Maidene&slong; maidenes &punctelev; withoute eche wicke dede
Ȝwane ȝe Endleue endleue togadere beothþ &punctelev; þat huy eou finden ȝeot þerto
Euerech of eov a þou&slong;end maidene&slong; &punctelev; to &slong;erui eou also
Þat ȝwane ȝe alle togadere beoth &punctelev; þat ech mouwe in is &slong;ide
honouri hire Maidenhod maidenhod and þin &punctelev; þat it beo couth wel wide
So þat Men men ne mouwen Maide maide non &punctelev; alo&slong;ed ⁁finde aȝein þe
And þat he wolle c&combtildevert;&slong;tine Cristine bicome &punctelev; þi louerd þat &slong;chal beo
In þis fo&rrot;eward graunte him &punctelev; aftur þe þ&rrot;idde ȝere
I&slong;pou&slong;ed to beon in gode&long; Godes lawe &punctelev; And and ne haue þerof no fere
·24·
Þo þat maide iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; glad heo wa&slong; of is lo&rrot;e
Þat heo wu&slong;te ȝwarewith heo miȝhte &punctelev; bringue hire fader of is &slong;o&rrot;e
¶Sone heo wende to hire fader &punctelev; and bad þat he ire telle &slong;cholde
Ȝwy þat he so mourninde ȝeode &punctelev; he &slong;eide þat he nolde
"Ich wot wel þi þouȝt þat maide &slong;eide &punctelev; þei þou it holde &slong;tille
Of þi &slong;onde ne haue no doute &punctelev; ichulle don al þi wille
Þo bigan heo tellen him in ȝwuche manere &punctelev; a&slong;e þe Aungel aungel hire hadde i&slong;eid
heo wolde habbe þene heiȝe Man man &punctelev; ȝif þat it were is red
¶Welle glad wa&slong; þe kyng &punctelev; þo þat he iheo&rrot;de þis
Þe Me&slong;&slong;agers messagers he ȝaf An&slong;were Answere &punctelev; &slong;one with gret blis
Þo huy
it b&rrot;ouȝten þe kingue&slong; &slong;one &punctelev; þe tiþingue wel him payde
Sone he liet Baptizen baptizen him &punctelev; fo&rrot; loue of þat Maide maide
And þo&rrot;uȝ is fader and þo&rrot;uȝ him &punctelev; and þo&rrot;uȝ þe oþur kingue
Endleue þou&slong;end of clene maidenes &punctelev; to þis maide huy guonne b&rrot;ingue
heo wa&slong; glad of þe compaygnie &punctelev; þat &slong;o fair to hire cam
Sone heo bigan in p&rrot;iueite &punctelev; telle heom of c&combtildevert;&slong;tinedom Cristinedom
Þat fo&rrot; hire loue and fo&rrot; hire p&rrot;echingue &punctelev; alle c&combtildevert;&slong;tine Cristine huy were
Louerd ȝwuch a compaygnie &punctelev; of clene maidene&slong; was þere
¶So gret Ioye ioye þe king of is douȝter hadde &punctelev; and of ire faire ferrade
Þat he liet heom makien a quoynte schip &punctelev; of lengþe and of b&rrot;ede
Þat huy &slong;cholden in þe se &punctelev; pleiȝe ȝwane huy wolde
Þat ech man alonde and in watere &punctelev; heo&rrot;e maydenhod p&rrot;e&slong;ie preisie &slong;cholde
huy &slong;ounguen ofte a watere and eke a lond &punctelev; and treche&slong; huy gonne lede
And oþurmanere faire pleie&slong; &punctelev; and al was of clene dedes
Mete and d&rrot;inke &slong;tilleliche &punctelev; to þe schip huy lieten b&rrot;ingue
To þ&rrot;eo ȝere&slong; &slong;u&slong;tinaunce &punctelev; withoute leue of þe kingue
¶A dai huy wenten into þe se &punctelev; and pleiden heom up and doun
Fo&rrot; Ioye ioye þere &slong;toden to biholden heom &punctelev; Men men of mani a toun
A&slong;e huy weren in me&slong;t Ioye ioye of plei &punctelev; ore louerd ane wynd &slong;ende
Þat d&rrot;of heom feo&rrot; into þe se &punctelev; þat men nu&slong;ten ȝwodere huy wende
Welle glade were þis maydenes þo &punctelev; þe wind heom d&rrot;of wel bliue
To þe cite of coloyne Coloyne &punctelev; fo&rrot;me&slong;t huy gonne ariue
¶To Damoysele ourse Ourse þe kyngues douȝhter &punctelev; an Aungel aungel cam þere
And bad hire lede wel hire compaygnye &punctelev; fo&rrot;to huy imartrede were
And &slong;eide þat huy &slong;cholden fo&rrot;þere fare &punctelev; and alle aȝein wende
And in þulke toune fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerde&slong; loue &punctelev; imartrede beon atþenende
Glad was þat Mayde mayde fo&rrot; þis wo&rrot;d &punctelev; fo&rrot;thþ huy wenden anon
Atþe cite of Ba&slong;ilie &punctelev; huy ariueden echon
¶Fram þulke Cite cite euerechone &punctelev; a fote huy wenden to Rome
Gret Ioye ioye made þe pope with heom &punctelev; þo huy þudere come
Fo&rrot; manie of heom weren neiȝh him sibbe &punctelev; and fo&rrot; he was of b&rrot;utayne Brutayne
Cyriac is name was &punctelev; huy weren of him wel fayne
An Aungel aungel cam to þe pope a niȝht &punctelev; and &slong;eide þat he &slong;cholde
With þis Maydene&slong; maydenes
imarted imartred beo &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd it &slong;o wolde
After þat tyme þis holie man &punctelev; honourede heom þe mo&rrot;e
·24· XI milia virgines 24 55
And p&rrot;echede heom ofte of clanne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; and of o&rrot;e louerdes lo&rrot;e
Tweolf monþe and endleue woke&slong; &punctelev; alle þis
Mayde mayde nes maydenes
maydenes were
At Rome with þis holie pope &punctelev; þat heom dude wel lere
¶Ake þe pope seint Seint
Ciriac &punctelev; is con&slong;eil cleopie gan
His clerkes and is Cardinale&slong; cardinales &punctelev; and Mani mani on oþer Man man
Bifo&rrot;e heom al i&slong; dignete &punctelev; he tok up atþen ende
And &slong;eide he wolde into an oþur lond &punctelev; with þis maydenes wende
¶Þis Cardinales cardinales weren þareaȝein &punctelev; and &slong;eiden þat he gan reue
With fole wu&combmacr;men wummen fo&rrot;to go &punctelev; and is dignete bileue
Naþele&slong; he wende fo&rrot;th with heom &punctelev; al aȝein heo&rrot;e rede
Þe Cardinales cardinales and is clerkes &punctelev; gret &slong;chame þarefo&rrot;e him &slong;eide
Tweie luþere p&rrot;inces þare weren &punctelev; Maximin and Affrican
Þouȝten þat þis Mayden&slong; maydenes wolden &punctelev; tuy&rrot;ne mani a man
To heo&rrot;e Mey mey þe p&rrot;ince of Coloyne &punctelev; huy &slong;enden fo&rrot;þenone
Þat he ȝwane huy þudere comen &punctelev; A&slong;lowe aslowe heom euerechone
¶Þat child þat &slong;cholde þis Mayde mayde wedde &punctelev; a&slong;e heo hadde i&slong;eid
Kyng was imaud of Enguelonde &punctelev; þo is fader was ded
Þat ladde &slong;wiþe cha&slong;te lijf &punctelev; and longuede &slong;wiþe so&rrot;e
With þat clene Maide maide to &slong;peke &punctelev; and beo · þo&rrot;uȝ &slong;trencþe of gode&long; Godes lo&rrot;e
An Aungel aungel cam to him and bad &punctelev; þat he on alle wi&slong;e
his Moder moder and is ȝungue&slong;te &slong;o&slong;ter &punctelev; anonriȝht liete Baptize baptize
And he with heom to Coloygne &punctelev; wiende with al his mayne
Aȝein is trewe &slong;pou&slong;e þat was &punctelev; Mayde mayde
Ourse of b&rrot;utayne Brutayne
Þat heo he him to hire leide fa&slong;te &punctelev; in wille and eke in dede
And endede heo&rrot;e lijf in gode&long; Godes &slong;erui&slong;e &punctelev; a&slong;e heo heom wolde rede
¶þis ȝongue with gret ioye dude &punctelev; þat þe Aungel aungel him gan lere
his moder and is &slong;o&slong;ter he nam &punctelev; þo huy ibaptizede were
And þe Bi&slong;chop bischop
Clement also &punctelev; þat ibaptized heom hadde
Toward coloyne Coloyne fo&rrot;th with him &punctelev; aȝen þis Maydenes maydenes he ladde
Swiþe glad was þis ȝongue king &punctelev; þo he to is lefMan lefman cam
And al&slong;o glad wa&slong; þat Maide maide &punctelev; þo heo &slong;aiȝh him in c&combtildevert;&slong;tinedom Cristinedom
Me&slong;t Ioye ioye heo made with is ȝongue &slong;o&slong;ter &punctelev; þat hiet Flo&rrot;entyne Florentyne
Þat heo clene Mayde mayde &slong;cholde &punctelev; &slong;offrie deþes pine
¶Ourse of Brutayne þene ȝoungue king &punctelev; in grete Ioye ioye of loue gan lere
Þat he him heolde fa&slong;te to hire &punctelev; and ne bilefde fo&rrot; no fere
Þat huy miȝhten in trewe loue &punctelev; togadere imartred beo
And wonye in heuene with Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
c&combtildevert;&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat bouȝte heom on þe treo
Al þis grauntede þis ȝoungue king &punctelev; and is lefmane nouȝt ne wernde
his fur&slong;te þouȝt into treowe loue &punctelev; and into clanne&slong;&slong;e he turnde
¶Þe heþene p&rrot;inces iredi was &punctelev; þo huy to Coloyne comePerhaps the subpointing of "s" in "princes" is a stray mark or a mistake since the poem continues in the third person plural.
With manie luþere heþene Men men &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie huy nome
And huweden and crieden on heom a &slong;chame &punctelev; and to grounde heom aslowe
And a&slong;e &slong;o fale wolues among lamb&rrot;en &punctelev; heo&rrot;e flechs huy tod&rrot;owe
Þo huy comen to þis clene þing &punctelev; Maide maide
Ourse of Brutayne
Þat huy founden so fair a creature &punctelev; of hire huy weren wel fayne
XI milia virgines ·24·
Þe p&rrot;ince hire nam and hire bihiet &punctelev; to laten hire gon aliue
And fo&rrot; heo wa&slong; &slong;o fair and noble &punctelev; habbe hire to wiue
¶Þis Maide maide &slong;eide þat heo nolde to hire &slong;pou&slong;e &punctelev; him ne non oþur take
Þe p&rrot;ince neiȝh fo&rrot; wrathþe wod &punctelev; þo he was &slong;o fur&slong;ake
he liet hire to deþe scheote &punctelev; with Aruwene aruwene atþenende
And þus heo and al hire compaygnie &punctelev; to þe Ioye ioye of heuene gan wiende
And þe ȝongue king of Enguelonde &punctelev; and is Moder moder al&slong;o
And is ȝongue &slong;o&slong;ter flo&rrot;entine Florentine &punctelev; to deþe weren ido
And þe pope Ciriac &punctelev; and Bi&slong;chopes bischopes mani on
Þat fo&rrot; trewe hope of Martyrdom martyrdom &punctelev; with heom weren igon
Ore louerd hadde &slong;wiþe gret Ioye ioye &punctelev; of þat &slong;wete ferrede
þat swuch m&rabar;tyrdom martyrdom martyrdom fo&rrot; is loue &punctelev; afenguen withoute d&rrot;ede
In þe to hond&rrot;ede ȝere &punctelev; and eiȝte and þrittiþe ȝere
After o&rrot;e louerdes buy&rrot;tyme &punctelev; þis maidenes imartrede were
¶Þis endleue þou&slong;end of clene maydenes &punctelev; and al þis compaygnie
Iburede weren in Coloyne &punctelev; in one No&combmacr;nerie nonnerie
An Abbot abbot þere was biside &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;de of þis cas
And ofte of þis clene Maydene&slong; maydenes &punctelev; þat gret Miracle miracle þere was
he bad þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e of Coloyne &punctelev; þat heo him g&rabar;unti graunti &slong;cholde
A bodi of þis clene Maydene&slong; maydenes &punctelev; and he wolde it don in golde
Þo þis bodi was him itake &punctelev; twelf Monþe monþe he liet it beo
Withoute seluer oþur gold &punctelev; in one che&slong;te of treo
¶Þo þe twelf monþes weren ago &punctelev; a&slong;e þe Moneke&slong; monekes weren echone
A nyȝt at Matines matines þis þis
holie bodi &punctelev; aros hire up allone
heo beuȝ hire to þe heiȝe weued &punctelev; and wende mildeliche
Among al þe couent couen fo&rrot;thþ &punctelev; and out wel &slong;tilledliche stilleliche
Þe Monekus monekus þo huy þis i&slong;eiȝen &punctelev; ofd&rrot;adde and so&rrot;ien so&rrot;ie were
huy eoden to þe che&slong;te þare heo
was inne ileid &punctelev; and ne founden ire nouȝt þere
¶Þis quath þe Abbod is o&rrot;e wreche &punctelev; fo&rrot; we hire ido nadde
In a sch&rrot;ine of gold a&slong;e we biheten &punctelev; þo we ire hidere ladden
To þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e of Coloyne &punctelev; þe Abbod wende anon
And tolde þis cas al hou it was &punctelev; of þat Maide maide igon
huy wenden fo&rrot;thþ to þulke &slong;tude &punctelev; þare heo wa&slong; ileid inne er
And heuen up þe þrouwe&slong; lid &punctelev; and founden hire ligge þer
Faire and euene a&slong;e heo dude er &punctelev; so luyte lime þere nas
Þat ne lai a&slong;e heo wa&slong; fur&slong;t ileid &punctelev; a fair Miracle miracle þere was
Þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e was þo swyþe glad &punctelev; and þe Nonne&slong; nonnes euerechon
And þonkede god God of þat faire Miracle miracle &punctelev; and heiȝe &slong;ounguen anon
¶Þe Abbot bad þat he mo&slong;te habbe &punctelev; þis holie bodi eftsone
And &slong;eide he wolde honouri it faire &punctelev; a&slong;e he auȝte fo&rrot;to done
Ake þe Abbe&slong;&slong;e nolde g&rabar;unti graunti it nouȝt &punctelev; ne þat couent noþur
Þat eft it &slong;cholde habbe awei &punctelev; þei he hadde ibeo heo&rrot;e b&rrot;oþur
Fo&rrot; huy i&slong;eiȝen þat it wa&slong; gode&long; Godes wille &punctelev; þat it bilefde þere
Þis Abbod abbod wende him hom aȝein &punctelev; with wel d&rrot;eo&rrot;ie chere
Nou god God u&slong; g&rabar;unti graunti ȝif is wille is &punctelev; þat we moten iwinne·
¶Þe heiȝe Ioye ioye of heo
uene &punctelev; þare alle þis
Maydene&slong; maydenes beoth inne
Ne þat we neuere
þarof ne mi&slong;&slong;en &punctelev; fo&rrot;
nome none &slong;o&rrot;ie &slong;unne· The last two lines are written in the right margin opposite lines 169-174.
